item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "If I am the pawn of the gods, it is because they know me so well, not because they make my mind up for me." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "I am who I choose to be. I have always been what I chose, though not always what I pleased." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description:
"The Paradoxical Commandments
People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives. Do good anyway.
If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies. Succeed anyway.
The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway.
Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable. Be honest and frank anyway.
The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds. Think big anyway.
People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs. Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight. Build anyway.
People really need help but may attack you if you do help them. Help people anyway.
Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth. Give the world the best you have anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "This wasn't prayer anyway, it was just argument with the gods. Prayer, he suspected as he hoisted himself up and turned for the door, was putting one foot in front of the other. Moving all the same." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Events may be horrible or inescapable. Men have always a choice - if not whether, then how, they may endure." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "His outflung hands traced over the threads of his rug, passed loop by loop through some patient woman's hands. Or maybe she hadn't been patient. Maybe she'd been tired, or irritated, or distracted, or hungry, or angry. Maybe she had been dying. But her hands had kept moving, all the same." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Since no one is perfect, it follows that all great deeds have been accomplished out of imperfection. Yet they were accomplished, somehow, all the same." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lauren Willig
item.description: "Whether I like it or not, most of my images of what various historical periods feel, smell, or sound like were acquired well before I set foot in any history class. They came from Margaret Mitchell, from Anya Seton, from M.M. Kaye, and a host of other authors, in their crackly plastic library bindings. Whether historians acknowledge it or not, scholarly history’s illegitimate cousin, the historical novel, plays a profound role in shaping widely held conceptions of historical realities." -- Lauren Willig

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "If the truth doesn't save us, what does that say about us?" -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "No 'Glory shall be your reward' for me. Oh, no, for me, it is, 'Stop whining' and 'Go to bed'." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "Calf love doesn't usually survive amputation, Your Majesty." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "When the souls rise up in glory, yours shall not be shunned nor sunderered, but shall be the prize of the gods' gardens. Even your darkness shall be treasured then, and all your pain made holy." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Flanagan
item.description: "Never give up because, if an opportunity arises, you have to be ready to take it." -- John Flanagan

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Flanagan
item.description: "How can you stay so calm?" It helps if you're terrified." -- John Flanagan

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Some prices are just too high, no matter how much you may want the prize. The one thing you can't trade for your heart's desire is your heart." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Home is where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "The way to get on with a cat is to treat it as an equal - or even better, as the superior it knows itself to be." -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "When one is striding bravely into the future one cannot watch one's footing. " -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"As I stood outside in Cow Lane, it occurred to me that Heaven must be a place where the library is open twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
No ... eight days a week." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Flanagan
item.description:
"But what if I make a mistake?' Will asked.
Gilan threw back his head and laughed. 'A mistake? One mistake? You should be so lucky. You'll make dozens! I made four or five on my first day alone! Of course you'll make mistakes. Just don't make any of them twice. If you do mess things up, don't try to hide it. Don't try to rationalize it. Recognize it and admit it and learn from it. We never stop learning, none of us." -- John Flanagan

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Flanagan
item.description: "Sometimes people can be too intellegent for their own good. Too much thinking could confuse things." -- John Flanagan

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.
